title: [BUG] MultiRocketMultivariate does not enforce np.float64 datatype and order
body:
**Describe the bug**
MultiRocketMultivariate requires and explicit casting of an 3d numpy array to np.float64


**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
from sktime.transformations.panel.rocket import MultiRocketMultivariate, MiniRocketMultivariate
import numpy as np

X_train64 = np.arange(128).reshape([2,4,16]).astype(np.float64)
X_train32 = np.arange(128).reshape([2,4,16]).astype(np.float32)

# works below
model =  MultiRocketMultivariate(random_state=42)
X_t_t = model.fit_transform(X_train64 )

# fails below
model =  MultiRocketMultivariate(random_state=42)
X_t_t = model.fit_transform(X_train32)

   [..] raise TypeError(msg)
TypeError: No matching definition for argument type(s) array(float32, 3d, C), array(int32, 1d, C), array(int32, 1d, C), array(int32, 1d, C), array(int32, 1d, C), array(float32, 1d, C), int64

# works below
model =  MiniRocketMultivariate(random_state=42)
X_t_t = model.fit_transform(X_train64 )

# works below
model =  MiniRocketMultivariate(random_state=42)
X_t_t = model.fit_transform(X_train32)
```



**Expected behavior**
float32 and float64 gets adjusted automatically

**Additional context**
<!--
Add any other context about the problem here.
-->
